reviews.title: Fun place to work at
reviews.text: Enjoyed it very much to work here! Friendly team and very helpful managers, good central location and normal working hours. Positive mindset, great environment

reviews.title: Ambiente de trabajo divertido buena comunicación y resolución de problemas rápido
reviews.text: Novedoso alegre y competitivo para estos tiempos fue una experiencia donde también aprendí mucho en él área de trato al cliente

reviews.title: On call sporadic out of the way requiring transport for low pay.
reviews.text: Okay to gain experience for entry level cleaning etc...not always easy to travel to and not Stanley work low pay sporadic on call work requiring much work for little pay.
reviews.cons: Low pay Never know how many hours of work available to budget

reviews.title: Sales targets changed every month, by change if you hit your targets comission went down and targets went up the following month.
reviews.text: Sales manager with no sales experience. Call time is preferred over actual sales numbers. Forced positivity trying promote a culture which on the outside looks great but is often toxic.

reviews.title: Great environment and team to work with
reviews.text: Good place and company to work with. Pay could be better, but a good environment and team to work with. I've worked with them as a Superhost but for me, it still counts as an excellent experience.
reviews.cons: Hard to please everyone and customers.
reviews.pros: Pay Much much better than other comparing website options and hotel offers

reviews.title: J’ai adoré travailler chez AirBnB!!!!!
reviews.text:
J’ai adoré travailler chez AirBnB!!!! J’ai travaillé en Irelande il y avait un gros groupe international on se connaissait tous! Super ambiance!! 

Bons formateurs et possibilité de changer de poste rapidement.

Même si nos emplois du temps étaient nuls on avait le droit d’échanger des jours avec des collègues et au final de se produire un emploi du temps idéal 

Je recommence cette boîte sans hésitation!!!

reviews.title: Energetic, fun and rewarding
reviews.text: Always enjoy waking up and feeling happy for another work day. Some of the guests will make you treats or a gift because they see you every day. Makes it enjoyable
reviews.cons: Some days are too long Only because someone has not shown up

reviews.title: It's good job if you are a host however, Air BnB is horrible when it comes to compensation for guest damages.
reviews.text: It's good job if you are a host however, Air BnB is horrible when it comes to compensation for guest damages. My home was ruined by a guest and had 23,000 in damages but Air BnB was reluctant to do anything about it.

reviews.title: Okay place to work, no room for growth
reviews.text: Okay place to work no room for growth gets boring after a while.  Management doesn't get too involved when there's an issue you have to figure it out on your own.

reviews.title: Ambiente lavorativo meritocratico  stimolante e possibile crescita
reviews.text: Esperienza positiva di gestione bnb consiglio di collaborare con questa azienda

reviews.title: Amazing manager, and easy to get in the routine
reviews.text: Working for Airbnb with my manager was great, he was very kind and my job cleaning the house wasn’t hard, just tedious work and having to do the same cleaning every couple days or sometimes every other day. But it was definitely worth the money and my manager communicated with me well and if I had questions they were happy to help. It’s not hard to get in the roll of things.
reviews.cons: Just depends on how many people decide to book that week. The winter months were usually slow.
reviews.pros: I was by myself most of the time, you can just jam out to your own music and clean. Also kept me motivated, only have to work 2 hours a day if that, where I worked atleast. get a reasonable amount for

reviews.title: Immature
reviews.text: Immature work place with very few opportunities. People were very cliquish and mean. Nobody really cared. People slacked off and played nerf guns in the office.

reviews.title: Muy buena app para emprendedores
reviews.text: Es una app muy buena para.comenzar cualquier emprendimiento.

reviews.title: Recruiting
reviews.text:
Awesome company! Airbnb is all about trust, transparency, and creating a sense belonging. Own your impact and make big decisions.

Leadership team is also great!

reviews.title: Motivating leadership, they really make you feel like you are apart of the group.
reviews.text: Airbnb reached out to me to be a volunteer moderator for their Facebook Host page. I was hosting a house for over a year and had to deal with customer service a lot. So basically this position is unique in that the experience is gained in the field.

reviews.title: Meeting exciting people from all over the world.
reviews.text:
I am a people's person so I  get a chance to meet people from all over the world.
Some of them are  friendly and  some tolerate the host..
However my job is to make all of them comfortable, happy and keep them safe doing their stay.
reviews.cons: some guests are impossible to please 100%.
reviews.pros: Tips and gifts from the guests

reviews.title: Its not a bad company to work for
reviews.text: I for the most part loved working for Airbnb . nice flexible hours and good pay . Didn't have no complaints until the homeowners girlfriend came back from New Mexico and complaints started by her to the co host and they stopped paying me so now I'm trying to collect my $625.00 cleaning  for services not paid for in full without having to file in small claims court
reviews.pros: Good pay and close to home

reviews.title: They really try to stand out and have a creative way to solve problems. Work culture is very accepting and broad
reviews.text: Was not bad to work for, but not paid well. Had to deal with very difficult customers due to other mistakes made by agents in different locations and sometimes not even in English.

reviews.title: Empresa agradável de trabalhar. Procupados com o bem estar dos empregados. Ambiente jovem.
reviews.text:
A parte mais agradável do meu trabalho é resolver os problemas dos clientes e deixa-los satisfeitos. 

Tem óptimos supervisores e gerentes.
A parte mais difícil do trabalho é o stress.
O ambiente de trabalho é agradável.
Meus colegas são de diversos paises, onde tenho a oportunidade de conversar em Inglês, Espanhol e outros idiomas.

Aprendi a resolver os problemas do clientes durante e depois das reservas. Visando deixar os clientes satisfeitos.
reviews.pros: Vale-refeição, pontualidade nos dias de pagamento.

reviews.title: Great sweet beginnings gone sour
reviews.text:
I’m a couch-surfer at heart, so when I found out about Airbedandbreakfast, I was not entirely sold. Recently graduated and jobless, I decided to give the company a chance in 2011 and...I loved it! Everybody I met (for the most part) was sweet and genuine and believed in “The Mission”. However, as time went by, I felt myself fighting the plight to become a cog in the industrious and social-media driven machine—Efforts to improve workflows were overlooked, chaos seemed to reign in almost every project that was set forth, and Team Leads and Coordinators failed to address relevant points without complicating an issue further.

Of course, to add more salt to the wound, nevermind that you will also get to see that primal greedy side of people at all times (both company-wise and clients): Yeah, a client might be in the wrong here and there, but in truth, the website/app can be convoluted and depending on who tends to your case: Good Luck with getting a refund! As for my ex-teammates: Good luck with moving forward and/or repeating yourself relentlessly and/or disengaging or even apologizing for technological misgivings or misunderstandings which are out of your control. 

My greatest disappointment was being a part of the first Covid-19 related workflow overhaul. My Team and I were not clear on what to do most of the time (regardless of Leads stepping in and playing make-believe support). It was a poor attempt at dealing with a crisis, and sadly, it showed.  

After absolutely no heads-up at any given moment during the pandemic, my Team and many others disintegrated into Nothingness on May 5, 2020,

Yeah—Remote work *can* be great, but if you must constantly choose between your sanity and the job...is it really worth it?
